definition-item.definition-title: SYSTEMS ACTING BY MEANS OF FLUIDS IN GENERAL; FLUID-PRESSURE ACTUATORS, e.g. SERVOMOTORS; DETAILS OF FLUID-PRESSURE SYSTEMS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Systems transferring mechanical energy by means of a fluid under pressure using the principles of fluid statics or hydrostatics, i.e. hydraulic or pneumatic systems
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hydraulically or pneumatically operated lifting devices for soil-working machines
Hydraulic or pneumatic tipping devices for vehicles
Hydraulic or pneumatic remote control for railway signals
Safety valves with auxiliary fluid operation of the main valve

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: using air or an inert gas (except steam) as a pressure medium.
using a liquid as the pressure medium.
system or device in which a substantially constant amount of fluid is trapped between an input member and an output member to act as a fluid link

fluid-pressure actuator, e.g. a piston and a cylinder, directly controlled by a valve or other device (e.g. pump) which is responsive to operation of an initial controlling member (e.g. joystick). The initial controlling member may be adjacent to the servomotor or at a distance and may be, e.g. a hand lever.

definition-item.definition-title: Installations or systems with accumulators; Supply reservoir or sump assemblies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
The main group F15B1/00 is complemented by the main group F15B2201/00 and is used for classifying invention information only.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: vessel for storing pressurised liquid (e.g. using a liquid and a gas chamber separated by a membrane or piston or using an elastic housing)

definition-item.definition-title: Installations or systems with accumulators

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: vessel for storing pressurised liquid (e.g. using a liquid and a gas chamber separated by a membrane or piston or using an elastic housing)

definition-item.definition-title: {used for damping}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pumps having accumulators for reducing pressure pulsations

definition-item.definition-title: {used as an emergency power source, e.g. in case of pump failure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B2211/212 takes precedence

definition-item.definition-title: {used as a supplementary power source, e.g. to store energy in idle periods to balance pump load}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Also for recuperation of hydraulic energy (as e.g. used in hydraulic excavators)
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dredgers or soil-shifting machinery with energy recovery arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: {used for thermal compensation, e.g. to collect expanded fluid and to return it to the system as the system fluid cools down}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: having accumulator charging devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. valves controlling flow of hydraulic fluid to and from the liquid chamber of an accumulator.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control of fluid pressure in general

definition-item.definition-title: Accumulators

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Vessel for storing pressurised liquid (e.g. using a liquid and a gas chamber separated by a membrane or piston or using an elastic housing).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pumps having accumulators for reducing pressure pulsations

section-body.paragraph-text: The sub-group F15B1/04 is complemented by the main group F15B2201/00

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: using a gas cushion; Gas charging devices; Indicators or floats therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B2201/205 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: {the accumulator having a fusible plug}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Accumulators with a safety plugs that melt at a certain temperature for relieving the pressure.

definition-item.definition-title: {the gas cushion being entirely enclosed by the separating means, e.g. foam or gas-filled balls}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B2201/3154 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: with flexible separating means

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Accumulators with flexible separating means but without gas cushion

section-body.paragraph-text: F15B2201/315 takes precedence.
Accumulators not using a gas cushion are classified in F15B1/04 even if they have flexible separating means (e.g. a membrane).

definition-item.definition-title: {the separating means being bellows}

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the attachment means (F15B1/14 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: F15B1/14 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: {in the form of a bladder}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Accumulators using bladders, i.e. essentially cylindrical flexible separating means having a first open end portion which is normally rounded and a second end portion with a fluid inlet for separating a hydraulic fluid and a gas.
Fig. from US2006042707
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B2201/3152 takes precedence.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

F15B2201/43 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: fixed to the separating means

definition-item.definition-title: Liquid port constructions

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B2201/41 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: with rigid separating means, e.g. pistons

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B2201/31 takes precedence.
Accumulators using springs and no gas cushion are classified in F15B1/04 even if they have rigid separating means (e.g. a piston).

definition-item.definition-title: Supply reservoir or sump assemblies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fluid supply systems for power Power-steering systems with reservoirs

definition-item.definition-title: {with pressurised main reservoir}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Intensifiers or fluid-pressure converters, e.g. pressure exchangers; Conveying pressure from one fluid system to another, without contact between the fluids {(fluid-driven pumps F04B9/08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for converting fluid energy, i.e. from a flow of fluid having high pressure and low flow rate to a flow of fluid having low pressure and high flow rate or vice versa.
E.g. devices using pistons of different size or rotating fluid pumps and motors of different capacity.
Fig. from FR2822906
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pressure intensifiers in processes of separation using semi-permeable membranes, e.g. dialysis, osmosis

definition-item.definition-title: Transducers converting variations of physical quantities, e.g. expressed by variations in positions of members, into fluid-pressure variations or vice versa; Varying fluid pressure as a function of variations of a plurality of fluid pressures or variations of other quantities (F15B9/00 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Systems in which the movement produced is definitely related to the output of a volumetric pump; Telemotors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. systems wherein a master cylinder is directly connected to a slave cylinder. Illustrative example:
Fig. from WO2006129746
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combinations of telemotor and servomotor systems

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: system or device in which a substantially constant amount of fluid is trapped between an input member and an output member to act as a fluid link, e.g. realised as a master cylinder which is directly connected to a slave cylinder.

definition-item.definition-title: {With multiple inputs, e.g. for dual control}

definition-item.definition-title: In which the ratio between pump stroke and motor stroke varies with the resistance against the motor

section-body.paragraph-text: F15B15/00 takes precedence for slave cylinders.

definition-item.definition-title: Input units; Master units

definition-item.definition-title: Servomotors with follow-up action, {e.g. obtained by feed-back control,} i.e. in which the position of the actuated member conforms with that of the controlling member

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fluid power drives using position feed-back
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: fluid-pressure acutator, e.g. a piston and a cylinder, directly controlled by a valve or other device (e.g. pump) which is responsive to operation of an initial controlling member (e.g. joystick). The initial controlling member may be adjacent to the servomotor or at a distance and may be, e.g. a hand lever.

definition-item.definition-title: in which the controlling element and the servomotor each controls a separate member, these members influencing different fluid passages or the same passage

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Fig. from US4733601

definition-item.definition-title: in which both the controlling element and the servomotor control the same member influencing a fluid passage and are connected to that member by means of a differential gearing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This class is also used for systems with a differential gear ratio of 1:1. Illustrative example:
Fig. from FR74115

definition-item.definition-title: Systems essentially having two or more interacting servomotors {, e.g. multi-stage (F15B18/00, F15B20/00 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. multi-stage systems
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Parallel arrangements of independent servomotor systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Servomotor systems without provision for follow-up action and circuits therefor
The main group F15B11/00 is omplemented by the main group F15B2211/00 and is used for classifying invention information only. F15B2211/00 takes precedence.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: fluid-pressure acutator, e.g. a piston and a cylinder, directly controlled by a valve or other device (e.g. pump) which is responsive to operation of an initial controlling member (e.g. joystick). The initial controlling member may be adjacent to the servomotor or at a distance and may be, e.g. a hand lever.

This class comprises releasable check valves and proportional braking valves.

table-column.paragraph-text: Systems for controlling the actuator force

definition-item.definition-title: {Special measures for cooling or heating}

section-body.paragraph-text: When the fluid powering the fluid-actuated device is used for cooling or for heating said device, either one of F15B21/0423 additional information when the fluid-actuated device is cooled or F15B21/0427 additional information when the device is heated, has to be allocated complementary to the classification in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Combined units comprising both motor and pump

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Locking mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Locking valves not combined with the actuator

definition-item.definition-title: {using positive interengagement, e.g. balls and grooves, for locking in the end positions}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Locking mechanisms using positive interengagement for locking in any distinct position (not restricted to locking in the end positions).

definition-item.definition-title: {Screw mechanisms attached to the piston}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This subgroup contains documents relating to locking mechanisms using screw mechanisms attached to the piston but not using friction.

definition-item.definition-title: {using electromagnetic radiation, e.g. radar or microwaves}

section-body.paragraph-text: F15B15/2846 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: Combinations of telemotor and servomotor systems

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Parallel arrangements of independent servomotor systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. redundant systems.
Fig. from DE1940946A1

definition-item.definition-title: Testing; {Calibrating; Fault detection or monitoring; Simulation or modelling of} fluid-pressure systems or apparatus not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Safety arrangements for fluid actuator systems; Applications of safety devices in fluid actuator systems; Emergency measures for fluid actuator systems

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control during or prevention of an electric or electronic failure
Control during or prevention of an hydraulic or pneumatic failure
Control during or prevention of a human failure
Control measures for coping with failures
Safety devices for pneumatic or hydraulic control systems

definition-item.definition-title: {Electrical failure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control during or prevention of electric or electronic failures

definition-item.definition-title: {Fluid pressure supply failure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Leakage; Spillage; Hose burst}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Valve failure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Compensation or avoidance of ambient pressure variation}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Systems with a pressurised main reservoir

definition-item.definition-title: {Reduction of noise or vibration}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Servomotor systems with programme control derived from a store or timing device; Control devices therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Servomotor systems with electrically operated control means

definition-item.definition-title: Special measures taken in connection with the properties of the fluid

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Using the fluid for cooling or heating a fluid-actuated device, i.e. a fluidic actuator

section-body.paragraph-text: When the fluid is used for cooling or heating a specific component, e.g. an electric motor, other than a fluid-actuated device, i.e. a fluidic actuator, it is classified in F15B21/04 as inventive information and in F15B21/0423 additional information when the fluid is used for cooling said component, or F15B21/0427 additional information when the fluid is used for heating said component.

definition-item.definition-title: Controlling the temperature of the fluid

section-body.paragraph-text: When the fluid is used for cooling or heating a specific component, e.g. an electric motor, classification in F15B21/04 applies in accordance with the special rule of F15B21/04.

definition-item.definition-title: Heating

section-body.paragraph-text: Control of a cooling device to increase the temperature of the fluid, e.g. bypassing a cooling device for warmup, is classified in F15B21/0427 as inventive information and also in F15B21/0423 as additional information.

definition-item.definition-title: Removal or measurement of undissolved gas, e.g. de-aeration, venting or bleeding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: Compensating for variations in viscosity or temperature

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Preventing foaming, churning or cavitation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control during or prevention of cavitation

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for compressed air preparation, e.g. comprising air driers, air condensers, filters, lubricators or pressure regulators

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Use of special fluids, e.g. liquid metal; Special adaptations of fluid-pressure systems, or control of elements therefor, to the use of such fluids

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Actuators having special fluid pressurization means

definition-item.definition-title: {Use of electro- or magnetosensitive fluids, e.g. electrorheological fluid}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control specific to the type of fluid, e.g. specific to magnetorheological fluid

definition-item.definition-title: {using a data bus, e.g. "CANBUS"}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
F15B13/0867 takes precedence.

definition-item.definition-title: Delay devices or arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Delay devices associated with fluid motors or actuators

definition-item.definition-title: Fluid oscillators or pulse generators

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fluid oscillators used for computing or control purposes

definition-item.definition-title: Energy-recuperation means

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Systems for storing electric energy in the form of pneumatic energy

definition-item.definition-title: having additional valves for interconnecting the fluid chambers of a double-acting actuator, e.g. for regeneration mode or for floating mode

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Floating position connecting the working ports and the return line
Regenerative position connecting the working ports or connecting the working ports to the pump, e.g. for high-speed approach stroke
